intro: Brosimum amplicoma, commonly known as the giant balsa tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The tree is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that develop into clustered, edible fruits. Its bark and wood have been historically used for various purposes, including construction and traditional medicine. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
